intro: Goniothalamus dielsianus, commonly known as the Diels' goniothalamus, is a member of the Annonaceae family, native to Southeast Asia. It is a small evergreen tree or shrub characterized by its simple, opposite, and elliptical leaves. The plant produces fragrant, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically clustered in umbels, and it bears spherical, woody fruits containing several seeds. Its botanical features make it an important species in tropical forest ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
